intro: Sarga timorensis, commonly known as the Timor sarga, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale yellow. Sarga timorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
